title: torch.Size — PyTorch 2.9 documentation
text:
## torch.Size#

Created On: Apr 19, 2024 | Last Updated On: Jun 18, 2025
torch.Sizeis the result type of a call totorch.Tensor.size(). It describes the size of all dimensions
of the original tensor. As a subclass oftuple, it supports common sequence operations like indexing and
length.
torch.Size
torch.Tensor.size()
tuple
Example:

```python
    >>> x = torch.ones(10, 20, 30)
    >>> s = x.size()
    >>> s
    torch.Size([10, 20, 30])
    >>> s[1]
    20
    >>> len(s)
    3

```

Return number of occurrences of value.
Return first index of value.
Raises ValueError if the value is not present.
Returns the number of elements atorch.Tensorwith the given size would contain.
torch.Tensor
More formally, for a tensorx=tensor.ones(10,10)with sizes=torch.Size([10,10]),x.numel()==x.size().numel()==s.numel()==100holds true.
x=tensor.ones(10,10)
s=torch.Size([10,10])
x.numel()==x.size().numel()==s.numel()==100
Example:

```python
>>> x=torch.ones(10, 10)
>>> s=x.size()
>>> s
torch.Size([10, 10])
>>> s.numel()
100
>>> x.numel() == s.numel()
True

```

Warning
This function does not return the number of dimensions described bytorch.Size, but instead the number
of elements atorch.Tensorwith that size would contain.
torch.Size
torch.Tensor
